name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
What actions do I need to take now? 

Other than filing your 2021 taxes to ensure the IRS has your up to date family information, no action is needed at this time. Keep an eye out for more information later this year on how the monthly delivery will work.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
How long will these payments be made for? 

This credit is currently only for 2021, but I‚Äôm fighting to make them permanent!

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
Who qualifies for this credit? 

Individuals who make up to $75,000 a year or joint filers making up to $150,000 a year qualify for the tax credit. From there, the funds will be reduced by 50 dollars for every additional one thousand dollars of gross income.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
How will this credit be delivered? 

For the first time, a portion of the credit will be delivered monthly, beginning in the second half of this year. Families will receive the rest when filing 2021 taxes in 2022.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
How much will qualifying families receive? 

Families with children under 6 will receive an increased credit, totaling $3,600 per child. Families with children ages 6-17 will receive a total credit of $3K per child.   Family income can no longer be too low to receive the credit.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text: The expansion of the #ChildTaxCredit championed by my friend @RosaDeLauro was included in the #AmericanRescuePlan and will cut childhood poverty across the country by 50%! That‚Äôs a pretty big deal. Here‚Äôs some FAQ we‚Äôve received ‚¨áÔ∏è

Today I‚Äôm voting to extend the bipartisan Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) that was set to expire at the end of March.
¬†

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text: For more information on stimulus checks visit https://t.co/wMN2gjEjIe

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
What if I don‚Äôt usually file taxes?

The IRS is urging people who don‚Äôt normally file a tax return to look into their filing options. Visit https://t.co/vlh4eSlfQI for more information about options available.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
What if the IRS does not have my information?

You can input your direct deposit information using the IRS‚Äôs ‚ÄúGet My Payment‚Äù tool, see link below!
https://t.co/Pphn4NVtnk

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
How will I get my payment?

Payments will be directly deposited into bank accounts, or come in the mail as a paper check or debit card. Visit the IRS‚Äôs "Get My Payment‚Äù tool to find out how the IRS will be delivering your payment.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
What do I need to do to claim my payment?

Most eligible people will get the 3rd stimulus check automatically & won‚Äôt need to take more action. The IRS will use available information from your most recent tax return to determine eligibility & which bank account to send it to.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
Do qualifying dependents also receive a check? What about adult dependents?

Yes and yes! Qualifying families receive $1,400 for each dependent. That includes adult dependents over the age of 17 too! So if you‚Äôre a single mother with 2 dependents, you will receive $4,200!

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
Will I get a stimulus check if I make over 75K?

Maybe. Individuals making under $80,000 and married filers making under $160,000 will receive a reduced payment. Households over those incomes will not receive a payment.

name: Rep. John Larson
tweet_text:
Who qualifies for a stimulus check, and how much would I get?

If you‚Äôre a single filer and earn less than $75,0000 annually you qualify. If you‚Äôre married & filing jointly and earn less than $150,000 you qualify! Qualifying individuals will receive $1,400

tweet_text: This expansion also raises thresholds for the Child Tax Credit to include middle class families. In Connecticut, this will help more than 720,000 children! 83% of children in CT will benefit from this! This wouldn't have been possible without the work of Chairwoman @RosaDeLauro!

tweet_text: Additionally, it is critical the federal government steps up to aid those who have lost their job, have been furloughed, or had hours cut back. We need to get cash to people to help them weather this storm  ‚Äì including retirees, the disabled, and families.
